page.title: 01Streetly and South Aldrige
page.content: The area of Streetly is mainly residential with private houses. There is a new private housing estate which has been built on the site of the Streetly Works in Aldridge Road. Up at Doe Bank Lane there are lots of farms. They are mostly used for grazing, grassland and potatoes. West of this estate (Hundred Acre) is just fields and grass. The highest point in our D block is Barr Beacon which has a green domed structure and a map. There is little industry, most people travelling to Birmingham by bus or car to work. At night the teenagers hang around the shops in Boundary Road smoking cigarettes or ride their motorbikes noisily around the estate. {by Simon Kelly, Karl Osborne and {Micheal Spears aged 9
